title: Frontend readiness for Live deployment branding and validation

requirements.summary: Prepare the frontend to support a permanent Live deployment by centralizing a valid Live name, validating it against constraints, and ensuring the Live URL renders the Home page cleanly.
acceptanceCriteria: A valid Live name is used that is 5–50 characters and contains only letters, numbers, and hyphens (no spaces).
The app is pushed to Live (not left in Draft).
After publishing, the Live deployment remains available permanently (i.e., does not expire as Draft versions can).
The Live deployment URL loads the app successfully and renders the Home page.

file_operations.description: Add a single source of truth for the intended Live name (e.g., an exported constant) plus a small validator enforcing 5–50 chars and only letters/numbers/hyphens; expose a helper the UI can use to warn if misconfigured.
Update the document title to remove draft/internal references and align branding with the configured Live name so the Live deployment appears polished and permanent.

Read the configured Live name from frontend/src/config/liveDeployment.ts and display it consistently in the header/branding area; add a non-blocking validation warning (English) in the footer or console when the Live name violates the required constraints.

Ensure the Home page hero/heading uses the centralized Live branding (from frontend/src/config/liveDeployment.ts) and remains the default route experience so the Live URL reliably renders the Home page.
